00046 #define EC_MBOX_TYPE_SOE 0x05
00047 
00050 enum ec_soe_opcodes {
00051     OPCODE_READ_REQUEST   = 0x01, 
00052     OPCODE_READ_RESPONSE  = 0x02, 
00053     OPCODE_WRITE_REQUEST  = 0x03, 
00054     OPCODE_WRITE_RESPONSE = 0x04  
00055 };
00056 
00059 #define EC_SOE_SIZE 0x04
00060 
00063 #define EC_SOE_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT 1000
00064 
00065 /*****************************************************************************/
00066 
00067 void ec_fsm_soe_read_start(ec_fsm_soe_t *, ec_datagram_t *);
00068 void ec_fsm_soe_read_request(ec_fsm_soe_t *, ec_datagram_t *);
00069 void ec_fsm_soe_read_check(ec_fsm_soe_t *, ec_datagram_t *);
00070 void ec_fsm_soe_read_response(ec_fsm_soe_t *, ec_datagram_t *);
00071 
00072 void ec_fsm_soe_write_start(ec_fsm_soe_t *, ec_datagram_t *);
00073 void ec_fsm_soe_write_request(ec_fsm_soe_t *, ec_datagram_t *);
00074 void ec_fsm_soe_write_check(ec_fsm_soe_t *, ec_datagram_t *);
00075 void ec_fsm_soe_write_response(ec_fsm_soe_t *, ec_datagram_t *);
00076 
00077 void ec_fsm_soe_end(ec_fsm_soe_t *, ec_datagram_t *);
00078 void ec_fsm_soe_error(ec_fsm_soe_t *, ec_datagram_t *);
00079 
00080 /*****************************************************************************/
00081 
00082 extern const ec_code_msg_t soe_error_codes[];
00083 
00084 /*****************************************************************************/
00085 
00088 void ec_print_soe_error(const ec_slave_t *slave, uint16_t error_code)
00089 {
00090     const ec_code_msg_t *error_msg;
00091 
00092     for (error_msg = soe_error_codes; error_msg->code; error_msg++) {
00093         if (error_msg->code == error_code) {
00094             EC_SLAVE_ERR(slave, "SoE error 0x%04X: \"%s\".\n",
00095                    error_msg->code, error_msg->message);
00096             return;
00097         }
00098     }
00099 
00100     EC_SLAVE_ERR(slave, "Unknown SoE error 0x%04X.\n", error_code);
00101 }

00107 void ec_fsm_soe_init(
00108         ec_fsm_soe_t *fsm 
00109         )
00110 {
00111     fsm->state = NULL;
00112     fsm->datagram = NULL;
00113     fsm->fragment_size = 0;
00114 }

00120 void ec_fsm_soe_clear(
00121         ec_fsm_soe_t *fsm 
00122         )
00123 {
00124 }

00126 /*****************************************************************************/
00127 
00130 void ec_fsm_soe_transfer(
00131         ec_fsm_soe_t *fsm, 
00132         ec_slave_t *slave, 
00133         ec_soe_request_t *request 
00134         )
00135 {
00136     fsm->slave = slave;
00137     fsm->request = request;
00138 
00139     if (request->dir == EC_DIR_OUTPUT) {
00140         fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_write_start;
00141     } else {
00142         fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_read_start;
00143     }
00144 }
00145 
00146 /*****************************************************************************/
00147 
00152 int ec_fsm_soe_exec(
00153         ec_fsm_soe_t *fsm, 
00154         ec_datagram_t *datagram 
00155         )
00156 {
00157     int datagram_used = 0;
00158 
00159     if (fsm->datagram &&
00160             (fsm->datagram->state == EC_DATAGRAM_INIT ||
00161              fsm->datagram->state == EC_DATAGRAM_QUEUED ||
00162              fsm->datagram->state == EC_DATAGRAM_SENT)) {
00163         // datagram not received yet
00164         return datagram_used;
00165     }
00166 
00167     fsm->state(fsm, datagram);
00168 
00169     datagram_used =
00170         fsm->state != ec_fsm_soe_end && fsm->state != ec_fsm_soe_error;
00171 
00172     if (datagram_used) {
00173         fsm->datagram = datagram;
00174     } else {
00175         fsm->datagram = NULL;
00176     }
00177 
00178     return datagram_used;
00179 }
00180 
00181 /*****************************************************************************/
00182 
00187 int ec_fsm_soe_success(const ec_fsm_soe_t *fsm )
00188 {
00189     return fsm->state == ec_fsm_soe_end;
00190 }

00192 /*****************************************************************************/
00193 
00196 void ec_fsm_soe_print_error(ec_fsm_soe_t *fsm )
00197 {
00198     ec_soe_request_t *request = fsm->request;
00199 
00200     EC_SLAVE_ERR(fsm->slave, "");
00201 
00202     if (request->dir == EC_DIR_OUTPUT) {
00203         printk("Writing");
00204     } else {
00205         printk("Reading");
00206     }
00207 
00208     printk(" IDN 0x%04X failed.\n", request->idn);
00209 }
00210 
00211 /******************************************************************************
00212  * SoE read state machine
00213  *****************************************************************************/
00214 
00219 int ec_fsm_soe_prepare_read(
00220         ec_fsm_soe_t *fsm, 
00221         ec_datagram_t *datagram 
00222         )
00223 {
00224     uint8_t *data;
00225     ec_slave_t *slave = fsm->slave;
00226     ec_master_t *master = slave->master;
00227     ec_soe_request_t *request = fsm->request;
00228 
00229     data = ec_slave_mbox_prepare_send(slave, datagram, EC_MBOX_TYPE_SOE,
00230             EC_SOE_SIZE);
00231     if (IS_ERR(data)) {
00232         return PTR_ERR(data);
00233     }
00234 
00235     EC_WRITE_U8(data, OPCODE_READ_REQUEST | (request->drive_no & 0x07) << 5);
00236     EC_WRITE_U8(data + 1, 1 << 6); // request value
00237     EC_WRITE_U16(data + 2, request->idn);
00238 
00239     if (master->debug_level) {
00240         EC_SLAVE_DBG(slave, 0, "SCC read request:\n");
00241         ec_print_data(data, EC_SOE_SIZE);
00242     }
00243 
00244     fsm->request->jiffies_sent = jiffies;
00245     fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_read_request;
00246 
00247     return 0;
00248 }
00249 
00250 /*****************************************************************************/
00251 
00254 void ec_fsm_soe_read_start(
00255         ec_fsm_soe_t *fsm, 
00256         ec_datagram_t *datagram 
00257         )
00258 {
00259     ec_slave_t *slave = fsm->slave;
00260     ec_soe_request_t *request = fsm->request;
00261 
00262     EC_SLAVE_DBG(slave, 1, "Reading IDN 0x%04X of drive %u.\n", request->idn,
00263             request->drive_no);
00264 
00265     if (!(slave->sii.mailbox_protocols & EC_MBOX_SOE)) {
00266         EC_SLAVE_ERR(slave, "Slave does not support SoE!\n");
00267         fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_error;
00268         ec_fsm_soe_print_error(fsm);
00269         return;
00270     }
00271 
00272     request->data_size = 0;
00273     fsm->retries = EC_FSM_RETRIES;
00274 
00275     if (ec_fsm_soe_prepare_read(fsm, datagram)) {
00276         fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_error;
00277         ec_fsm_soe_print_error(fsm);
00278     }
00279 }
00280 
00281 /*****************************************************************************/
00282 
00285 void ec_fsm_soe_read_request(
00286         ec_fsm_soe_t *fsm, 
00287         ec_datagram_t *datagram 
00288         )
00289 {
00290     ec_slave_t *slave = fsm->slave;
00291     unsigned long diff_ms;
00292 
00293     if (fsm->datagram->state == EC_DATAGRAM_TIMED_OUT && fsm->retries--) {
00294         if (ec_fsm_soe_prepare_read(fsm, datagram)) {
00295             fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_error;
00296             ec_fsm_soe_print_error(fsm);
00297         }
00298         return;
00299     }
00300 
00301     if (fsm->datagram->state != EC_DATAGRAM_RECEIVED) {
00302         fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_error;
00303         EC_SLAVE_ERR(slave, "Failed to receive SoE read request: ");
00304         ec_datagram_print_state(fsm->datagram);
00305         ec_fsm_soe_print_error(fsm);
00306         return;
00307     }
00308 
00309     diff_ms = (jiffies - fsm->request->jiffies_sent) * 1000 / HZ;
00310 
00311     if (fsm->datagram->working_counter != 1) {
00312         if (!fsm->datagram->working_counter) {
00313             if (diff_ms < EC_SOE_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT) {
00314                 // no response; send request datagram again
00315                 if (ec_fsm_soe_prepare_read(fsm, datagram)) {
00316                     fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_error;
00317                     ec_fsm_soe_print_error(fsm);
00318                 }
00319                 return;
00320             }
00321         }
00322         fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_error;
00323         EC_SLAVE_ERR(slave, "Reception of SoE read request"
00324                 " failed after %lu ms: ", diff_ms);
00325         ec_datagram_print_wc_error(fsm->datagram);
00326         ec_fsm_soe_print_error(fsm);
00327         return;
00328     }
00329 
00330     fsm->jiffies_start = fsm->datagram->jiffies_sent;
00331     ec_slave_mbox_prepare_check(slave, datagram); // can not fail.
00332     fsm->retries = EC_FSM_RETRIES;
00333     fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_read_check;
00334 }
00335 
00336 /*****************************************************************************/
00337 
00340 void ec_fsm_soe_read_check(
00341         ec_fsm_soe_t *fsm, 
00342         ec_datagram_t *datagram 
00343         )
00344 {
00345     ec_slave_t *slave = fsm->slave;
00346 
00347     if (fsm->datagram->state == EC_DATAGRAM_TIMED_OUT && fsm->retries--) {
00348         ec_slave_mbox_prepare_check(slave, datagram); // can not fail.
00349         return;
00350     }
00351 
00352     if (fsm->datagram->state != EC_DATAGRAM_RECEIVED) {
00353         fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_error;
00354         EC_SLAVE_ERR(slave, "Failed to receive SoE mailbox check datagram: ");
00355         ec_datagram_print_state(fsm->datagram);
00356         ec_fsm_soe_print_error(fsm);
00357         return;
00358     }
00359 
00360     if (fsm->datagram->working_counter != 1) {
00361         fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_error;
00362         EC_SLAVE_ERR(slave, "Reception of SoE mailbox check"
00363                 " datagram failed: ");
00364         ec_datagram_print_wc_error(fsm->datagram);
00365         ec_fsm_soe_print_error(fsm);
00366         return;
00367     }
00368 
00369     if (!ec_slave_mbox_check(fsm->datagram)) {
00370         unsigned long diff_ms =
00371             (fsm->datagram->jiffies_received - fsm->jiffies_start) *
00372             1000 / HZ;
00373         if (diff_ms >= EC_SOE_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT) {
00374             fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_error;
00375             EC_SLAVE_ERR(slave, "Timeout after %lu ms while waiting for"
00376                     " read response.\n", diff_ms);
00377             ec_fsm_soe_print_error(fsm);
00378             return;
00379         }
00380 
00381         ec_slave_mbox_prepare_check(slave, datagram); // can not fail.
00382         fsm->retries = EC_FSM_RETRIES;
00383         return;
00384     }
00385 
00386     // Fetch response
00387     ec_slave_mbox_prepare_fetch(slave, datagram); // can not fail.
00388     fsm->retries = EC_FSM_RETRIES;
00389     fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_read_response;
00390 }
00391 
00392 /*****************************************************************************/
00393 
00396 void ec_fsm_soe_read_response(
00397         ec_fsm_soe_t *fsm, 
00398         ec_datagram_t *datagram 
00399         )
00400 {
00401     ec_slave_t *slave = fsm->slave;
00402     ec_master_t *master = slave->master;
00403     uint8_t *data, mbox_prot, header, opcode, incomplete, error_flag,
00404             value_included;
00405     size_t rec_size, data_size;
00406     ec_soe_request_t *req = fsm->request;
00407 
00408     if (fsm->datagram->state == EC_DATAGRAM_TIMED_OUT && fsm->retries--) {
00409         ec_slave_mbox_prepare_fetch(slave, datagram); // can not fail.
00410         return;
00411     }
00412 
00413     if (fsm->datagram->state != EC_DATAGRAM_RECEIVED) {
00414         fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_error;
00415         EC_SLAVE_ERR(slave, "Failed to receive SoE read response datagram: ");
00416         ec_datagram_print_state(fsm->datagram);
00417         ec_fsm_soe_print_error(fsm);
00418         return;
00419     }
00420 
00421     if (fsm->datagram->working_counter != 1) {
00422         fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_error;
00423         EC_SLAVE_ERR(slave, "Reception of SoE read response failed: ");
00424         ec_datagram_print_wc_error(fsm->datagram);
00425         ec_fsm_soe_print_error(fsm);
00426         return;
00427     }
00428 
00429     data = ec_slave_mbox_fetch(slave, fsm->datagram, &mbox_prot, &rec_size);
00430     if (IS_ERR(data)) {
00431         fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_error;
00432         ec_fsm_soe_print_error(fsm);
00433         return;
00434     }
00435 
00436     if (master->debug_level) {
00437         EC_SLAVE_DBG(slave, 0, "SCC read response:\n");
00438         ec_print_data(data, rec_size);
00439     }
00440 
00441     if (mbox_prot != EC_MBOX_TYPE_SOE) {
00442         fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_error;
00443         EC_SLAVE_ERR(slave, "Received mailbox protocol 0x%02X as response.\n",
00444                 mbox_prot);
00445         ec_fsm_soe_print_error(fsm);
00446         return;
00447     }
00448 
00449     if (rec_size < EC_SOE_SIZE) {
00450         fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_error;
00451         EC_SLAVE_ERR(slave, "Received currupted SoE read response"
00452                 " (%zu bytes)!\n", rec_size);
00453         ec_print_data(data, rec_size);
00454         ec_fsm_soe_print_error(fsm);
00455         return;
00456     }
00457 
00458     header = EC_READ_U8(data);
00459     opcode = header & 0x7;
00460     incomplete = (header >> 3) & 1;
00461     error_flag = (header >> 4) & 1;
00462 
00463     if (opcode != OPCODE_READ_RESPONSE) {
00464         EC_SLAVE_ERR(slave, "Received no read response (opcode %x).\n",
00465                 opcode);
00466         ec_print_data(data, rec_size);
00467         ec_fsm_soe_print_error(fsm);
00468         fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_error;
00469         return;
00470     }
00471 
00472     if (error_flag) {
00473         req->error_code = EC_READ_U16(data + rec_size - 2);
00474         EC_SLAVE_ERR(slave, "Received error response:\n");
00475         ec_print_soe_error(slave, req->error_code);
00476         ec_fsm_soe_print_error(fsm);
00477         fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_error;
00478         return;
00479     } else {
00480         req->error_code = 0x0000;
00481     }
00482 
00483     value_included = (EC_READ_U8(data + 1) >> 6) & 1;
00484     if (!value_included) {
00485         EC_SLAVE_ERR(slave, "No value included!\n");
00486         ec_fsm_soe_print_error(fsm);
00487         fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_error;
00488         return;
00489     }
00490 
00491     data_size = rec_size - EC_SOE_SIZE;
00492     if (ec_soe_request_append_data(req,
00493                 data + EC_SOE_SIZE, data_size)) {
00494         fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_error;
00495         ec_fsm_soe_print_error(fsm);
00496         return;
00497     }
00498 
00499     if (incomplete) {
00500         EC_SLAVE_DBG(slave, 1, "SoE data incomplete. Waiting for fragment"
00501                 " at offset %zu.\n", req->data_size);
00502         fsm->jiffies_start = fsm->datagram->jiffies_sent;
00503         ec_slave_mbox_prepare_check(slave, datagram); // can not fail.
00504         fsm->retries = EC_FSM_RETRIES;
00505         fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_read_check;
00506     } else {
00507         if (master->debug_level) {
00508             EC_SLAVE_DBG(slave, 0, "IDN data:\n");
00509             ec_print_data(req->data, req->data_size);
00510         }
00511 
00512         fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_end; // success
00513     }
00514 }
00515 
00516 /******************************************************************************
00517  * SoE write state machine
00518  *****************************************************************************/
00519 
00522 void ec_fsm_soe_write_next_fragment(
00523         ec_fsm_soe_t *fsm, 
00524         ec_datagram_t *datagram 
00525         )
00526 {
00527     ec_slave_t *slave = fsm->slave;
00528     ec_master_t *master = slave->master;
00529     ec_soe_request_t *req = fsm->request;
00530     uint8_t incomplete, *data;
00531     size_t header_size, max_fragment_size, remaining_size;
00532     uint16_t fragments_left;
00533 
00534     header_size = EC_MBOX_HEADER_SIZE + EC_SOE_SIZE;
00535     if (slave->configured_rx_mailbox_size <= header_size) {
00536         EC_SLAVE_ERR(slave, "Mailbox size (%u) too small for SoE write.\n",
00537                 slave->configured_rx_mailbox_size);
00538         fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_error;
00539         ec_fsm_soe_print_error(fsm);
00540         return;
00541     }
00542 
00543     remaining_size = req->data_size - fsm->offset;
00544     max_fragment_size = slave->configured_rx_mailbox_size - header_size;
00545     incomplete = remaining_size > max_fragment_size;
00546     fsm->fragment_size = incomplete ? max_fragment_size : remaining_size;
00547     fragments_left = remaining_size / fsm->fragment_size - 1;
00548     if (remaining_size % fsm->fragment_size) {
00549         fragments_left++;
00550     }
00551 
00552     data = ec_slave_mbox_prepare_send(slave, datagram, EC_MBOX_TYPE_SOE,
00553             EC_SOE_SIZE + fsm->fragment_size);
00554     if (IS_ERR(data)) {
00555         fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_error;
00556         ec_fsm_soe_print_error(fsm);
00557         return;
00558     }
00559 
00560     EC_WRITE_U8(data, OPCODE_WRITE_REQUEST | incomplete << 3 |
00561             (req->drive_no & 0x07) << 5);
00562     EC_WRITE_U8(data + 1, 1 << 6); // only value included
00563     EC_WRITE_U16(data + 2, incomplete ? fragments_left : req->idn);
00564     memcpy(data + 4, req->data + fsm->offset, fsm->fragment_size);
00565 
00566     if (master->debug_level) {
00567         EC_SLAVE_DBG(slave, 0, "SCC write request:\n");
00568         ec_print_data(data, EC_SOE_SIZE + fsm->fragment_size);
00569     }
00570 
00571     req->jiffies_sent = jiffies;
00572     fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_write_request;
00573 }
00574 
00575 /*****************************************************************************/
00576 
00579 void ec_fsm_soe_write_start(
00580         ec_fsm_soe_t *fsm, 
00581         ec_datagram_t *datagram 
00582         )
00583 {
00584     ec_slave_t *slave = fsm->slave;
00585     ec_soe_request_t *req = fsm->request;
00586 
00587     EC_SLAVE_DBG(slave, 1, "Writing IDN 0x%04X of drive %u (%zu byte).\n",
00588             req->idn, req->drive_no, req->data_size);
00589 
00590     if (!(slave->sii.mailbox_protocols & EC_MBOX_SOE)) {
00591         EC_SLAVE_ERR(slave, "Slave does not support SoE!\n");
00592         fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_error;
00593         ec_fsm_soe_print_error(fsm);
00594         return;
00595     }
00596 
00597     fsm->offset = 0;
00598     fsm->retries = EC_FSM_RETRIES;
00599     ec_fsm_soe_write_next_fragment(fsm, datagram);
00600 }
00601 
00602 /*****************************************************************************/
00603 
00606 void ec_fsm_soe_write_request(
00607         ec_fsm_soe_t *fsm, 
00608         ec_datagram_t *datagram 
00609         )
00610 {
00611     ec_slave_t *slave = fsm->slave;
00612     unsigned long diff_ms;
00613 
00614     if (fsm->datagram->state == EC_DATAGRAM_TIMED_OUT && fsm->retries--) {
00615         ec_fsm_soe_write_next_fragment(fsm, datagram);
00616         return;
00617     }
00618 
00619     if (fsm->datagram->state != EC_DATAGRAM_RECEIVED) {
00620         fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_error;
00621         EC_SLAVE_ERR(slave, "Failed to receive SoE write request: ");
00622         ec_datagram_print_state(fsm->datagram);
00623         ec_fsm_soe_print_error(fsm);
00624         return;
00625     }
00626 
00627     diff_ms = (jiffies - fsm->request->jiffies_sent) * 1000 / HZ;
00628 
00629     if (fsm->datagram->working_counter != 1) {
00630         if (!fsm->datagram->working_counter) {
00631             if (diff_ms < EC_SOE_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT) {
00632                 // no response; send request datagram again
00633                 ec_fsm_soe_write_next_fragment(fsm, datagram);
00634                 return;
00635             }
00636         }
00637         fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_error;
00638         EC_SLAVE_ERR(slave, "Reception of SoE write request"
00639                 " failed after %lu ms: ", diff_ms);
00640         ec_datagram_print_wc_error(fsm->datagram);
00641         ec_fsm_soe_print_error(fsm);
00642         return;
00643     }
00644 
00645     fsm->jiffies_start = fsm->datagram->jiffies_sent;
00646 
00647     ec_slave_mbox_prepare_check(slave, datagram); // can not fail.
00648     fsm->retries = EC_FSM_RETRIES;
00649     fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_write_check;
00650 }
00651 
00652 /*****************************************************************************/
00653 
00656 void ec_fsm_soe_write_check(
00657         ec_fsm_soe_t *fsm, 
00658         ec_datagram_t *datagram 
00659         )
00660 {
00661     ec_slave_t *slave = fsm->slave;
00662 
00663     if (fsm->datagram->state == EC_DATAGRAM_TIMED_OUT && fsm->retries--) {
00664         ec_slave_mbox_prepare_check(slave, datagram); // can not fail.
00665         return;
00666     }
00667 
00668     if (fsm->datagram->state != EC_DATAGRAM_RECEIVED) {
00669         fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_error;
00670         EC_SLAVE_ERR(slave, "Failed to receive SoE write request datagram: ");
00671         ec_datagram_print_state(fsm->datagram);
00672         ec_fsm_soe_print_error(fsm);
00673         return;
00674     }
00675 
00676     if (fsm->datagram->working_counter != 1) {
00677         fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_error;
00678         EC_SLAVE_ERR(slave, "Reception of SoE write request datagram: ");
00679         ec_datagram_print_wc_error(fsm->datagram);
00680         ec_fsm_soe_print_error(fsm);
00681         return;
00682     }
00683 
00684     if (!ec_slave_mbox_check(fsm->datagram)) {
00685         unsigned long diff_ms =
00686             (datagram->jiffies_received - fsm->jiffies_start) * 1000 / HZ;
00687         if (diff_ms >= EC_SOE_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT) {
00688             fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_error;
00689             EC_SLAVE_ERR(slave, "Timeout after %lu ms while waiting"
00690                     " for write response.\n", diff_ms);
00691             ec_fsm_soe_print_error(fsm);
00692             return;
00693         }
00694 
00695         ec_slave_mbox_prepare_check(slave, datagram); // can not fail.
00696         fsm->retries = EC_FSM_RETRIES;
00697         return;
00698     }
00699 
00700     // Fetch response
00701     ec_slave_mbox_prepare_fetch(slave, datagram); // can not fail.
00702     fsm->retries = EC_FSM_RETRIES;
00703     fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_write_response;
00704 }
00705 
00706 /*****************************************************************************/
00707 
00710 void ec_fsm_soe_write_response(
00711         ec_fsm_soe_t *fsm, 
00712         ec_datagram_t *datagram 
00713         )
00714 {
00715     ec_slave_t *slave = fsm->slave;
00716     ec_master_t *master = slave->master;
00717     ec_soe_request_t *req = fsm->request;
00718     uint8_t *data, mbox_prot, opcode, error_flag;
00719     uint16_t idn;
00720     size_t rec_size;
00721 
00722     if (fsm->datagram->state == EC_DATAGRAM_TIMED_OUT && fsm->retries--) {
00723         ec_slave_mbox_prepare_fetch(slave, datagram); // can not fail.
00724         return; // FIXME: request again?
00725     }
00726 
00727     if (fsm->datagram->state != EC_DATAGRAM_RECEIVED) {
00728         fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_error;
00729         EC_SLAVE_ERR(slave, "Failed to receive SoE write"
00730                 " response datagram: ");
00731         ec_datagram_print_state(fsm->datagram);
00732         ec_fsm_soe_print_error(fsm);
00733         return;
00734     }
00735 
00736     if (fsm->datagram->working_counter != 1) {
00737         fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_error;
00738         EC_SLAVE_ERR(slave, "Reception of SoE write response failed: ");
00739         ec_datagram_print_wc_error(fsm->datagram);
00740         ec_fsm_soe_print_error(fsm);
00741         return;
00742     }
00743 
00744     data = ec_slave_mbox_fetch(slave, fsm->datagram, &mbox_prot, &rec_size);
00745     if (IS_ERR(data)) {
00746         fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_error;
00747         ec_fsm_soe_print_error(fsm);
00748         return;
00749     }
00750 
00751     if (master->debug_level) {
00752         EC_SLAVE_DBG(slave, 0, "SCC write response:\n");
00753         ec_print_data(data, rec_size);
00754     }
00755 
00756     if (mbox_prot != EC_MBOX_TYPE_SOE) {
00757         fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_error;
00758         EC_SLAVE_ERR(slave, "Received mailbox protocol 0x%02X as response.\n",
00759                 mbox_prot);
00760         ec_fsm_soe_print_error(fsm);
00761         return;
00762     }
00763 
00764     if (rec_size < EC_SOE_SIZE) {
00765         fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_error;
00766         EC_SLAVE_ERR(slave, "Received corrupted SoE write response"
00767                 " (%zu bytes)!\n", rec_size);
00768         ec_print_data(data, rec_size);
00769         ec_fsm_soe_print_error(fsm);
00770         return;
00771     }
00772 
00773     opcode = EC_READ_U8(data) & 0x7;
00774     if (opcode != OPCODE_WRITE_RESPONSE) {
00775         EC_SLAVE_ERR(slave, "Received no write response"
00776                 " (opcode %x).\n", opcode);
00777         ec_print_data(data, rec_size);
00778         ec_fsm_soe_print_error(fsm);
00779         fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_error;
00780         return;
00781     }
00782 
00783     idn = EC_READ_U16(data + 2);
00784     if (idn != req->idn) {
00785         EC_SLAVE_ERR(slave, "Received response for"
00786                 " wrong IDN 0x%04x.\n", idn);
00787         ec_print_data(data, rec_size);
00788         ec_fsm_soe_print_error(fsm);
00789         fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_error;
00790         return;
00791     }
00792 
00793     error_flag = (EC_READ_U8(data) >> 4) & 1;
00794     if (error_flag) {
00795         if (rec_size < EC_SOE_SIZE + 2) {
00796             EC_SLAVE_ERR(slave, "Received corrupted error response"
00797                     " - error flag set, but received size is %zu.\n",
00798                     rec_size);
00799         } else {
00800             req->error_code = EC_READ_U16(data + EC_SOE_SIZE);
00801             EC_SLAVE_ERR(slave, "Received error response:\n");
00802             ec_print_soe_error(slave, req->error_code);
00803         }
00804         ec_print_data(data, rec_size);
00805         ec_fsm_soe_print_error(fsm);
00806         fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_error;
00807         return;
00808     } else {
00809         req->error_code = 0x0000;
00810     }
00811 
00812     fsm->offset += fsm->fragment_size;
00813 
00814     if (fsm->offset < req->data_size) {
00815         fsm->retries = EC_FSM_RETRIES;
00816         ec_fsm_soe_write_next_fragment(fsm, datagram);
00817     } else {
00818         fsm->state = ec_fsm_soe_end; // success
00819     }
00820 }
00821 
00822 /*****************************************************************************/
00823 
00826 void ec_fsm_soe_error(
00827         ec_fsm_soe_t *fsm, 
00828         ec_datagram_t *datagram 
00829         )
00830 {
00831 }
00832 
00833 /*****************************************************************************/
00834 
00837 void ec_fsm_soe_end(
00838         ec_fsm_soe_t *fsm, 
00839         ec_datagram_t *datagram 
00840         )
00841 {
00842 }
